result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael T Graske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond applied. Remainder to be collected by Agent.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol unless has Agent's written approval.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael T Graske

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael T Graske in court with attorney Andrew W. Boden. 
John P Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
State moves to delete reference to domestic abuse 968.075. 
Court will delete domestic abuse provision. 
State has complied with victim notifications. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
No contest plea entered. 
Defendant questioned by the Court and advised of rights. 
Court accepts his plea and finds guilty of disorderly conduct. 
Recommendations by DA Snider and Atty Boden. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 1 year probation. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling and abide by treatment recommendations 
- not possess/consume alcohol unless Agent approves in writing 
Advised of appeal rights.
